name: liver or spleen granuloma
description: A small area of inflammation due to tissue injury, most often caused by an infection, in the liver or spleen

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The location of the granuloma within the organ

values.name: right hepatic lobe
values.description: Granuloma located in the right lobe of the liver

values.name: hepatic dome
values.description: Granuloma located in the dome of the liver

values.name: upper pole of the spleen
values.description: Granuloma located in the upper pole of the spleen

values.name: calcified
values.description: The granuloma has become hardened due to the deposition of calcium salts

values.name: unchanged
values.description: The granuloma has not changed in size or appearance since the last examination

values.name: small
values.description: The granuloma is small in size

values.name: scattered
values.description: The granulomas are spread out within the organ

values.name: multiple
values.description: There are multiple granulomas present within the organ

attributes.name: disease
attributes.description: The underlying disease process that caused the granuloma

values.name: prior granulomatous disease
values.description: The granuloma is a sequela of a prior granulomatous disease

values.name: postinflammatory
values.description: The granuloma is a result of a previous inflammatory process
